intro: Senecio dubitabilis var. densicapitatus, commonly known as the dense-headed senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a low-growing, mat-forming habit with narrow, blue-green leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow, arranged in dense, spherical clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
